adjective.description: Living or occurring at the same time.
examples: the event was recorded by a contemporary historian

adjective.description: Belonging to or occurring in the present.
examples: the tension and complexities of our contemporary society

noun.description: A person or thing living or existing at the same time as another.
examples: he was a contemporary of Darwin

origin: Mid 17th century: from medieval Latin contemporarius, from con- together with + tempus, tempor- time (on the pattern of Latin contemporaneus and late Latin contemporalis).
